ai.summary: A 14.6 km moderate hike along the historic Corpse Road to nearby tumuli, weaving through rural lanes, woodlands and open fields in the UK. The route offers glimpses of ancient earthworks and a sense of pastoral history, suitable for hikers with steady footing.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain: quiet rural lanes, compacted earth tracks, grassy field paths and short sections near tumuli. Expect occasional mud after rain, uneven surfaces, and several gentle ascents; wearing sturdy boots is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather: check forecasts and daylight hours before starting. Carry a map or GPS and fully charged phone. Stay on marked paths, wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing, and take regular breaks. Be mindful of livestock on lanes, gate and stile navigation, and farm traffic. Bring water and snacks, inform someone of your route and expected return time, and have a plan if you get lost.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with emergency contacts and portable power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (roughly March–October) offer the best conditions and daylight for this 14.6 km hike. The route can be walked in winter with extra gear, but conditions vary and mud and low visibility may be more common.

seo.title: Corpse Road and Tumuli Walk – 14.6 km Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore the historic Corpse Road and ancient tumuli on a 14.6 km moderate hike in the UK. Practical route notes, terrain, safety tips and gear recommendations.
